article.headline: Vermont 75, Hartford 55
article.story: WEST HARTFORD, Conn. (AP) -- Taylor Coppenrath led all scorers with 25 points and pulled down eight rebounds to help Vermont to a 75-55 win over Hartford Sunday. Vermont (15-3, 10-0 America East) scored the first seven points of the game, built a double-digit lead in just three minutes and never let the lead dip into single digits the rest of the game. Hartford (7-12, 3-7) missed nine of its first 11 attempts and fell behind 45-26 at halftime as Vermont shot 68 percent while the Hawks only managed 24 percent shooting. Hartford went on a 7-2 run with 11:15 remaining in the game to pull within 13 points. But Coppenrath hit a free throw and David Hehn hit a 3-pointer after a Hartford miss to give Vermont a 60-43 lead. The Hawks shot 31 percent for the game, but committed a season-low three turnovers. Charles Ford led Hartford with 13 points, while Aaron Cook and Bo Taylor each chipped in 12. Vermont outrebounded Hartford 45-27. T.J. Sorrentine had 16 points, seven rebounds and seven assists for the Catamounts, while Germain Mopa Njila added 13 points.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).
